noun.description: A wind instrument made from a tube with holes along it that are stopped by the fingers or keys, held vertically or horizontally so that the player's breath strikes a narrow edge. The modern orchestral form, typically made of metal, is held horizontally and has an elaborate set of keys.
An ornamental vertical groove in a column.

verb.description: Speak in a melodious way reminiscent of the sound of a flute.

origin: Middle English: from Old French flahute, probably from Provençal flaüt, perhaps a blend of flaujol flageolet + laüt lute.
